definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: That panted forth a flood of rapture so divine.
sentences.chinese: 能够迸涌出这样神圣的极乐音流。

sentences.english: The light of music illumines the world.
sentences.chinese: 你乐音的光芒普照世界。

sentences.english: Kreisler. Take it into world, and let people hear it.
sentences.chinese: 将小提琴带给世人，让所有人都听到它的乐音。

sentences.english: The harp answered with the magic Music of Tears.
sentences.chinese: 于是魔琴响起了悲伤的乐音。

sentences.english: Singers and instrumentalists have to be able to get evey note perfectly in tune.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱家和乐器演奏家一定要把乐音调试成最佳状态。

sentences.english: Some one was busy with her work, and her bangles made music in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 有人在忙着活计，角落里响着她脚镯鸣奏的乐音。

definition: music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
to perform on a musical instrument
(music) note/phonetic component of a Chinese character/phonetic symbol/phonogram
